Create an Adjacency Matrix from an Edgelist

Source: R/utility.R
get_adj_matrix_from_edgelist.Rd

Creates an adjacency matrix from an edgelist

Usage

get_adj_matrix_from_edgelist(
  edgelist = matrix(),
  source_colname = "source",
  target_colname = "target",
  value_colname = "weight",
  node_order = c()
)

Arguments

edgelist

An edgelist representing an fcm. Default column names are "source", "target", and "weight", but these may be defined explicitly.

source_colname

Column name in the input eddgelist that represents edge source nodes

target_colname

Column name in the input edgelist that represents edge target nodes

value_colname

Column name in the input edgelist that represents represents the values displayed in the adjacency matrix (i.e. weight, standard_deviation)

node_order

The order in which concepts should be arranged in the output adjacency matrix. If no input given, concepts will be arranged alphabetically.

Value

An adjacency matrix (data.frame)

Details

The input edgelist must have the following column names: 'source' or 'from', 'target' or 'to'. The user must manually note if different names are used for the edgelist. An additional column may be selected to describe a value attributed to a given edge (default value column name is 'weight').

The input edgelist can be either a matrix, data.frame, tibble, or data.table type object.

Examples

edgelist <- data.frame(
  "source" = c("C", "A", "D", "A", "C"),
  "target" = c("A", "B", "B", "D", "D"),
  "weight" = c(0.3, 0.5, 0.6, 1.0, 1.0)
)
get_adj_matrix_from_edgelist(edgelist)
#>   C   A D   B
#> C 0 0.3 1 0.0
#> A 0 0.0 1 0.5
#> D 0 0.0 0 0.6
#> B 0 0.0 0 0.0
